==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|わ|ごん}}
Probably coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived components, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=わごん|倭|tr1=wa|t1=Japan, Japanese|琴|tr2=gon|t2=koto, zither}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|わごん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|和琴}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|わごん}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=わごん|和琴}}: {{lb|ja|sort=わごん|music}} a six-stringed [[koto]] or [[zither]] used to perform [[kagura]] music, more common in ancient times

=====Usage notes=====
The {{m|ja|和琴}} spelling is much more common, due to the {{m|en|dwarf}} connotations of the {{m|ja|倭}} character.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|やまと|こと|k2=ごと|r=y}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=やまとごと|倭|tr1=Yamato|pos1=ancient name for Japan|琴|tr2=koto|t2=a koto, a zither}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=やまとごと|koto|goto}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|やまとごと|acc=4|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|大和琴}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|やまとごと}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=やまとごと|大和琴}}: {{lb|ja|sort=やまとごと|music}} a six-stringed [[koto]] or [[zither]] used to perform [[kagura]] music, more common in ancient times

=====Usage notes=====
The {{m|ja|大和琴}} spelling is much more common, due to the {{m|en|dwarf}} connotations of the {{m|ja|倭}} character.
